p: Consistent with H4b, same-kinship group estimates were positive in M2-7, but not significant in M2 and M 5 (58%), indicating that descendants of the main kinship descent group are more likely to learn from other kinship group members about illnesses, but not about medicinal species or uses. In M2-7 the probability of an edge forming between two people who are not both descendants of the main kinship group is higher for man-woman pairs than for same-gender pairs, but same-gender pairs are consistently more likely to be connected by an edge if they are both members of the main kinship group ( Fig 4), indicating that nonsignificance of kinship descent homophily may be related to cultural gender roles.
